channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2024030541
item.description:
Report X-2024030541

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DMP WAS CALLED FOR A SPILL AT THE END OF THE NIGHT. DMP WENT TO THE SPILL WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART, ALL APPROPRIATE PPE ON, AND CREATED A 15FT HOTZONE. THE DECISION TREE WAS USED. THE INITAL READING WAS OUT OF THE 6-9 RANGE. AFTER NEUTRALIZING THE SPILL WAS CONTAINED AND RETURNED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was already inside a black tub in QA when I arrived. DescribePack: The bottom of the bucket is crake open. The hazardous material is spilling through the hole when it is sitting up. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was double bagged and placed in a black tub in QA.

item.description:

item.title: Report X-2024030263
item.description:
Report X-2024030263

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030263 SequenceEvent: Package was found in Hazmat cage. Closures of box were open on the bottom. Drum was outside of the box. DescribePack: Upon close examination, no severe damage was seen on the drum but a small amount of spilled powder was seen inside of the plastic bag containing the drum. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Only a small amount of powder was seen next to the drum. 2. X-2024030264 SequenceEvent: Package was found in Hazmat cage. Bottom closure was coming open on box. A small amount of powder was seen next to the open closure. DescribePack: Upon inspection, the plastic bucket was cracked at the bottom causing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Bucket was placed into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024030498
item.description:
Report X-2024030498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on conveyor belt near a load door with small wet spots, then moved to Hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the four bottles of Result 100 Dish Machine Detergent had a loose cap and all 4 had spilled liquid on them. Cap was tightened but this bottle continued to exhibit a small drip when turned sideways. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Package was placed in a carrying tote lined with a Hazmat bag and moved to Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024030491
item.description:
Report X-2024030491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg leaked small amounts of product during transit. Pkg was loaded correctly, but the closure was loose so small amounts of product was able to be released. At discovery, the hazmat6 was transported to the hazmat processing area in a lined hazardous tote. DescribePack: Close on one bottle was super loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazardous material was immediately moved from the area so pkg handlers could continue the sort in a safely manner.

item.title: Report X-2024030265
item.description:
Report X-2024030265

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA, BAGGED, IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: ONE OF 4 BOTTLES MISSING CAP. NOT RECOVERED WITH DAMAGED CONTENTS OR PACKAGING. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CAP HOLE COVERED WITH A NITRILE GLOVE AT THE OPENING AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED. ENTIRE BOTTLE WAS LAYERED IN SHRINK WRAP. BOXES WERE PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED. ALL DAMAGED PACKAGING AND ALL CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED.

item.title: Report X-2024030319
item.description:
Report X-2024030319

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unknown. Package was left at hazmat cage with no information provided. Package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote. DescribePack: The package appears to have been dropped onto something sharp that punctured one of the interior containers, causing it to leak over the other containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Unknown. Package was left at hazmat cage with no information provided. Package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2024030251
item.description:
Report X-2024030251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA when package handler realized the top of the bucket was wet and leaking. DescribePack: The bucket was leaking through the small cap on the lid. This cap was not properly sealed correctly because it was seal at a crooked angle. Cap won't move due to the crooked angle and will still leak if corrosive liquid reach the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bucket was taken to QA and placed in a black tub for hazmat.

There was no spill in the truck, so at discovery the truck was evacuated and the hazmat was transported in a lined hazardous tote. DescribePack: cap of bottle was completely off. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The driver was told of how hazardous pkgs are suppose to be loaded. Package handlers were told what to do when finding a damage hazmat.

item.title: Report E-2024030191
item.description:
Report E-2024030191

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 4, 2024, ten (10) one-gallon pails of paint related material were crushed in transit and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the truck interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH utilized absorbents to recover the spilled product from the impacted trailer floor. All waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for future disposal. LSH repalletized the undamaged freight for continued shipping.

item.title: Report X-2024030327
item.description:
Report X-2024030327

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A manage was unloading a trailer on door 78. The package slip out of his hand and broke when it hit the ground. I was called over to clean it up when the manager realize liquid was coming out from the bottom. DescribePack: Part of the box got eaten away by the acid while I was making my way to unload 7. While I was cleaning up the package I found that only one glass bottle was broken. The other bottle was not damage nor was it leaking. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: I was wearing a apron and nitrile gloves while handling package. I used amphomag and absorbents to neutralized the spill. I put the glass bottles and box in one bag and placed the clean up in a another bag.

item.title: Report X-2024030445
item.description:
Report X-2024030445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on a cart in the Hazmat cage facing down. No leakage was visible on the outside. Styrofoam shards were falling out. DescribePack: When inspected. 2 2.5 liter glass bottles were inside. There are slots for 6 but only 2 are indicated on packing list. Molded Styrofoam is broken. 1 of the 2 bottles had a slow drip coming from near the cap but was still mostly full. Small wet stains could be seen inside the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was contained in a Hazmat bag when found. Leakage was not visible on the outside.

item.title: Report X-2024030342
item.description:
Report X-2024030342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It appears due to a buildup of pressure one of the bottles leaked a small amount of liquid when it fell during transport. Amount that leaked was contained by outer packaging. QA was notified and transported package to cage in red lined tote for further processing utilizing all proper PPE of gloves/goggles and face mask. DescribePack: Due pressure buildup, exit point was the cap due to it being weakest part of bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately putting package upright.

item.title: Report X-2024030236

Report X-2024030236

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was damaged on the 2/27 and left by QA cage on preload and brought to hazmat cage 2/29. And was coded a 06. One of the four bottles had a loose cap, and the outer packaging was ripped and torn. DescribePack: the bottle had a loose closure cap. the whole bottle was spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Was put in a hazardous tub to minimize further spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024030177
item.description:
Report X-2024030177

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: it appears that during transport there was a pressure buildup and when the package fell it caused it to leak a very small amount. This caused damage to the exterior box. QA was notified and package was removed from the area in a red lined tote while utilizing all appropriate PPE, gloves, googles and facemask. DescribePack: Failure occurred at the cap which was the weakest point to which liquid could escape. This was caused by a buildup of pressure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright.

item.title: Report E-2024030182
item.description:
Report E-2024030182

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 5, 2024 at 1213 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons KEROPUR AP 205-20, UN1307 3, III from (1) 55-gallon DM. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by a puncture from a nail and was contained to a small area on the trailer floor and a 2 x 2 area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged drum with product was placed in an 85-gallon overpack DM. All waste generated from addressing this release, was containerized in (1) 5-gallon poly drum, and (1) 85-gallon overpack DM, which was then staged onsite by the contractors for proper disposal.
